question:
You are a student at a language school in New Zealand studying Business English. Part of the course is a summer work placement program. Unfortunately, you have just learnt from the school that this programme has now been cancelled.


Write a letter to the School Principal. In your letter:


state your reason for writing
describe the problem and your concerns
explain what you would like the Principal to do.
text: I am a student at West Campus school; currently learning Business English. I am writing this letter to express my dissatisfaction with the recent changes in our course program.

I have chosen this course only because It was offering summer work placement as a part of its program. However, yesterday students were notified that work placement was cancelled. Personally, I was upset with the changes; hence, an opportunity to apply in practice everything that I learn is of overriding importance for me. There are other courses that suggest this opportunity.

I am afraid that I have to claim a 50% refund of my payment since this course is not the one I paid for anymore. I want to look for another program that can guarantee summer work placement. Hope you can understand my concerns and .
I look forward to your reply and a resolution to my problem.
